/* Infanticide */ --add facts but leave out disputed staff.
restore unexplained section removal and questionable question marks
/* Criticism */ a lot of small, random cleanups, corrections, linkages
/* Criticism */ a lot of small, random cleanups, corrections, linkages
/* Gender-based birthrate disparity */ rv what Miborovsky edited, see discussion
/* Overview */ fix: one (singular) children (plural), writing like Chef speaks is not in the manual of style.
spelling fixes, tidy, and general cleanup using [[Wikipedia:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
/* Children with pressure */ fix template display
This term is used by most westerners to refer to China's birth control policy. Fewer users use it only for China's urban birth control policy. See discussion.
/* Criticism */ --criticisms on one-child policy are published in popular Chinese web site like sina. One reference here from China Daily also shows criticism.
/* Children with pressure */ -- no obvious proof for the link of one child policy vs. pressure
/* Spoiled children */ --Never heard such a term in China as "little princess" refer to one child
/* Criticism */ -- removing POV words and cleanup...
/* Infanticide */ -- huh? POV to say that supporters of one-child policy claim widespread infanticide
-- infanticide refers to death of an infant, not a foetus... therefore reference to abortion as infanticide is inaccurate
-- birth rates do not bear on infanticide, as infanticide occurs after birth
/* Gender-based birthrate disparity */ -- okay... but clarifying and clean-up
/* Gender-based birthrate disparity */ one can be the family member of both families. But the key issue in traditional thoughts was daughter is not the member of her family.

overview should be in the first place of an article.
/* Overview */ - The news report is very possibliy not right as it is against the results of 4th population census of PRC.
/* The "One-Two-Four" problem */ correct error. A man with no kid married a woman with one kid can have their own kid in China.
/* Infanticide */ put views of other side here
/* The "One-Two-Four" problem */ According to [[People's Republic of China]], the sex ratio is m:f=1.096

chinese couples have been bearing many children since before there was any distinction, and the culture explained here is just as true outside the mainland.
